title: Manhattan DA delays subpoena seeking Trump tax returns
text:
President Trump pauses to chat as he walks back to the Oval Office after sheriffs presented him with an appreciation plaque at the South Portico of the White House on Sept. 26. (Jabin Botsford/The Washington Post)

The Manhattan district attorney has agreed to delay a subpoena seeking President Trump’s tax returns until Tuesday, while a federal judge considers Trump’s lawsuit seeking to have the subpoena thrown out.

That delay was announced late Thursday in a letter signed by both Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus R. Vance Jr. (D) and Trump’s private attorneys. Vance said he would not enforce a subpoena sent to Trump’s longtime accountants, Mazars USA, until Oct. 1.

Vance is investigating hush-money payments made during the 2016 campaign to two women who said they had affairs with Trump. Trump sued to stop Vance’s subpoenas earlier this month — arguing that, because he is president, he is immune from any criminal investigation by a local prosecutor.
description: Delay will provide time for a federal judge to consider a Trump lawsuit seeking to have the subpoena thrown out.
